taskbody.context: You can restore your instance from any given backup .tgz file. You could also duplicate your instance on a similar cluster for testing or failover purposes by restoring a backup .tgz file to a new similarly configured cluster.

step.cmd: Log in to the browser interface.
In the Applications table, identify the name of the instance to modify.
Stop the instance, and verify its subservices are stopped.

substep.cmd: In the Actions column of the Applications table, click Stop.
In the Stop Service dialog, click Stop Service and 52 ChildrenStop Service and 40 Children.
In the Applications column of the Applications table, click the name of the stopped instance, and then scroll down to the Services table to verify everything is stopped.

step.cmd: Click the Backup / Restore tab. The Backup / Restore page appears listing your backup files.
Click Restore Backup next to the backup file you want to use to restore your application. You will be asked to confirm your selection by clicking Restore.
When the restore is finished, click the Applications tab, then click Start next to the instance you just restored.
